text:
the model reads the input time steps using a diﬀerent sized kernel. For example, a three-headed
model may have three diﬀerent kernel sizes of 3, 5, 11, allowing the model to read and interpret
the sequence data at three diﬀerent resolutions. The interpretations from all three heads are then
concatenated within the model and interpreted by a fully-connected layer before a prediction is
made.
We can implement a multi-headed 1D CNN using the Keras functional API. The updated
